alert.note: Alert for McCurtain (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL LITTLE RIVER... SOUTHEASTERN MCCURTAIN...NORTHWESTERN BOWIE AND NORTHEASTERN RED RIVER COUNTIES THROUGH 515 AM CDT... At 445 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Idabel, or 21 miles northeast of Clarksville, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Idabel, Arkinda, Avery, Haworth, Bokhoma, Moon, Beaverdams, Goodlake, Harris, English, Tom, America, and Bryarly. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for southwestern Arkansas...southeastern Oklahoma...and northeastern Texas.
